Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: sanity
Description: Sanity CLI tool for managing Sanity installations, managing plugins, schemas and datasets

Arguments.Name: build
Arguments.Description: Builds the current Sanity configuration to a static bundle

Arguments.Name: --source-maps
Arguments.Description: Enable source maps for built bundles (increases size of bundle)

Arguments.Name: --no-minify
Arguments.Description: Skip minifying built JavaScript (speeds up build, increases size of bundle)

Arguments.Name: -y
Arguments.Description: Use unattended mode, accepting defaults and using only flags for choices

Arguments.Name: --dry
Arguments.Description: Dry run (no changes are made to files)

Arguments.Name: --extensions
Arguments.Description: Transform files with these file extensions (comma separated list) (default: js,ts,tsx)

Arguments.Name: configcheck
Arguments.Description: Checks if the required configuration files for plugins exists and are up to date

Arguments.Name: cors
Arguments.Description: Interact with CORS-entries for your project

Arguments.Name: add
Arguments.Description: Allow a new origin to use your project API through CORS

Arguments.Name: --credentials
Arguments.Description: Allow credentials (token/cookie) to be sent from this origin

Arguments.Name: --no-credentials
Arguments.Description: Disallow credentials (token/cookie) to be sent from this origin

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Delete an existing CORS-origin from your project

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List all origins allowed to access the API for this project

Arguments.Name: dataset
Arguments.Description: Interact with datasets in your project

Arguments.Name: alias
Arguments.Description: You can manage your dataset alias using this command

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Skips security prompt and forces link command

Arguments.Name: copy
Arguments.Description: Manages dataset copying, including starting a new copy job, listing copy jobs and following the progress of a running copy job

Arguments.Name: --detach
Arguments.Description: Start the copy without waiting for it to finish

Arguments.Name: --attach
Arguments.Description: Attach to the running copy process to show progress

Arguments.Name: --skip-history
Arguments.Description: Don't preserve document history on copy

Arguments.Name: --list
Arguments.Description: Lists all dataset copy jobs corresponding to a certain criteria

Arguments.Name: --offset
Arguments.Description: Start position in the list of jobs. Default 0. With --list

Arguments.Name: --limit
Arguments.Description: Maximum number of jobs returned. Default 10. Maximum 1000. With --list

Arguments.Name: create
Arguments.Description: Create a new dataset within your project

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Delete a dataset within your project

Arguments.Name: export
Arguments.Description: Export dataset to local filesystem as a gzipped tarball

Arguments.Name: --raw
Arguments.Description: Extract only documents, without rewriting asset references

Arguments.Name: --no-assets
Arguments.Description: Export only non-asset documents and remove references to image assets

Arguments.Name: --no-drafts
Arguments.Description: Export only published versions of documents

Arguments.Name: --no-compress
Arguments.Description: Skips compressing tarball entries (still generates a gzip file)

Arguments.Name: --types
Arguments.Description: Defines which document types to export

Arguments.Name: --overwrite
Arguments.Description: Overwrite any file with the same name

Arguments.Name: import
Arguments.Description: Import documents to given dataset from ndjson file

Arguments.Name: --missing
Arguments.Description: On duplicate document IDs, skip importing document in question

Arguments.Name: --replace
Arguments.Description: On duplicate document IDs, replace existing document with imported document

Arguments.Name: --allow-failing-assets
Arguments.Description: Skip assets that cannot be fetched/uploaded

Arguments.Name: deploy
Arguments.Description: Deploys a statically built Sanity studio

Arguments.Name: --source-maps
Arguments.Description: Enable source maps for built bundles (increases size of bundle)

Arguments.Name: --no-minify
Arguments.Description: Skip minifying built JavaScript (speeds up build, increases size of bundle)

Arguments.Name: --no-build
Arguments.Description: Don't build the studio prior to deploy, instead deploying the version currently in `dist/`

Arguments.Name: documents
Arguments.Description: Interact with documents in your project

Arguments.Name: --replace
Arguments.Description: On duplicate document IDs, replace existing document with specified document(s)

Arguments.Name: --missing
Arguments.Description: On duplicate document IDs, don't modify the target document(s)

Arguments.Name: --watch
Arguments.Description: Write the documents whenever the target file or buffer changes

Arguments.Name: --json5
Arguments.Description: Use JSON5 file type to allow a "simplified" version of JSON

Arguments.Name: --id
Arguments.Description: Specify a document ID to use. Will fetch remote document ID and populate editor

Arguments.Name: get
Arguments.Description: Get and print a document by ID

Arguments.Name: exec
Arguments.Description: Runs a script in Sanity context

Arguments.Name: --with-user-token
Arguments.Description: Preload access token from CLI config into 'part:@sanity/base/client' part

Arguments.Name: --mock-browser-env
Arguments.Description: Mocks a browser-like environment using jsdom

Arguments.Name: deploy
Arguments.Description: Deploy a GraphQL API from the current Sanity schema

Arguments.Name: --dataset
Arguments.Description: Deploy API for the given dataset

Arguments.Name: --tag
Arguments.Description: Deploy API to given tag (defaults to 'default')

Arguments.Name: --non-null-document-fields
Arguments.Description: Set document interface fields (_id, _type etc) as non-null

Arguments.Name: --playground
Arguments.Description: Deploy a GraphQL playground for easily testing queries (public)

Arguments.Name: --no-playground
Arguments.Description: Skip playground prompt (do not deploy a playground)

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Deploy API without confirming breaking changes

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Lists all the GraphQL endpoints deployed for this project

Arguments.Name: --dataset
Arguments.Description: Delete GraphQL API for the given dataset

Arguments.Name: --tag
Arguments.Description: Delete GraphQL API for the given tag (defaults to 'default')

Arguments.Name: hook
Arguments.Description: Interact with hooks in your project

Arguments.Name: attempt
Arguments.Description: Print details of a given webhook delivery attempt

Arguments.Name: create
Arguments.Description: Create a new hook for the given dataset

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Delete a hook within your project

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List hooks for a given project

Arguments.Name: logs
Arguments.Description: List latest log entries for a given hook

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initialize a new Sanity project or plugin

Arguments.Name: -y
Arguments.Description: Use unattended mode, accepting defaults and using only flags for choices

Arguments.Name: --project
Arguments.Description: Project ID to use for the studio

Arguments.Name: --organization
Arguments.Description: Organization ID to use for the project

Arguments.Name: --dataset-default
Arguments.Description: Set up a project with a public dataset named "production"

Arguments.Name: --output-path
Arguments.Description: Path to write studio project to

Arguments.Name: --create-project
Arguments.Description: Create a new project with the given name

Arguments.Name: --project-plan
Arguments.Description: Optionally select a plan for a new project

Arguments.Name: --coupon
Arguments.Description: Optionally select a coupon for a new project (cannot be used with --project-plan)

Arguments.Name: --reconfigure
Arguments.Description: Reconfigure Sanity studio in current folder with new project/dataset

Arguments.Name: install
Arguments.Description: Installs a Sanity plugin to the current Sanity configuration

Arguments.Name: login
Arguments.Description: Authenticates against the Sanity.io API (no flag) or a third-party identity provider (with --sso flag)

Arguments.Name: --sso
Arguments.Description: Authenticate against a third-party identity provider

Arguments.Name: logout
Arguments.Description: Logs out of the Sanity.io session

Arguments.Name: manage
Arguments.Description: Opens the Sanity project management UI

Arguments.Name: projects
Arguments.Description: Interact with projects connected to your logged in user

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Lists projects connected to your user

Arguments.Name: start
Arguments.Description: Starts a web server for the Content Studio

Arguments.Name: --port
Arguments.Description: TCP port to start server on. [default: 3333]

Arguments.Name: --host
Arguments.Description: The local network interface at which to listen. [default: "127.0.0.1"]

Arguments.Name: uninstall
Arguments.Description: Removes a Sanity plugin from the current Sanity configuration

Arguments.Name: upgrade
Arguments.Description: Upgrades all (or some) Sanity modules to their latest versions

Arguments.Name: --range
Arguments.Description: Version range to upgrade to, eg '^2.2.7' or '2.1.x'

Arguments.Name: --tag
Arguments.Description: Tagged release to upgrade to, eg 'canary' or 'some-feature'

Arguments.Name: --save-exact
Arguments.Description: Pin the resolved version numbers in package.json (no ^ prefix)

Arguments.Name: invite
Arguments.Description: Invite a new user to the project

Arguments.Name: --role
Arguments.Description: Role to invite the user as

Arguments.Name: --sort
Arguments.Description: Sort users by specified column: id, name, role, date

Arguments.Name: versions
Arguments.Description: Shows the installed versions of Sanity CLI and core components
